title: Custom Social Connections
name: custom-social-connections
author: auth0
description: This application gives Auth0 customers the possibility to manage custom social connections in an easy way

title: Auth0 Authentication API Debugger
name: auth0-authentication-api-debugger
author: auth0
description: This extension allows you to test and debug the various Authentication API endpoints

title: Bitbucket Deployments
name: auth0-bitbucket-deploy
author: auth0
description: This extension gives Auth0 customers the possibility to deploy Hosted Pages, Rules and Custom Database Connections from Bitbucket.
uninstallConfirmMessage: Do you really want to uninstall this extension? Doing so will stop any Hosted Pages, Rules and Database Connection scripts from being deployed from Bitbucket to Auth0

auth0.scopes: read:tenant_settings update:tenant_settings update:clients read:clients read:connections update:connections read:rules create:rules update:rules delete:rules delete:clients

BITBUCKET_REPOSITORY.description: The repository from which you want to deploy rules and database scripts

BITBUCKET_BRANCH.description: The branch we should monitor for commits

SLACK_INCOMING_WEBHOOK_URL.description: Webhook URL for Slack used to notify you of successful and failed deployments

title: Visual Studio Team Services Deployments
name: auth0-visualstudio-deploy
author: auth0
description: This extension gives Auth0 customers the possibility to deploy Hosted Pages, Rules and Custom Database Connections from Visual Studio Team Services.
uninstallConfirmMessage: Do you really want to uninstall this extension? Doing so will stop any Hosted Pages, Rules and Database Connection scripts from being deployed from Visual Studio Team Services to Auth0

auth0.scopes: read:tenant_settings update:tenant_settings update:clients read:clients read:connections update:connections read:rules create:rules update:rules delete:rules delete:clients

TFS_PROJECT.description: The project from which you want to deploy rules and database scripts

TFS_BRANCH.description: The branch we should monitor for commits

TFS_PATH.description: The path we should monitor for commits

TFS_INSTANCE.description: Your Visual Studio Team Services instance name (without .visualstudio.com)

TFS_USERNAME.description: Your Visual Studio Team Services username

TFS_TOKEN.description: Your personal access token for Visual Studio Team Services

SLACK_INCOMING_WEBHOOK_URL.description: Webhook URL for Slack used to notify you of successful and failed deployments

title: Auth0 AD/LDAP Connector Health Monitor
name: auth0-ldap-conector-health-monitor
author: auth0
description: This extension will expose an endpoint you can use from your monitoring tool to monitor your AD/LDAP Connectors

title: Auth0 Management API Webhooks
name: auth0-webhooks
author: auth0
description: Allows you to define webhooks for Auth0's Management API. It will go through the audit logs and call a webhook for specific events.

BATCH_SIZE.description: The amount of logs to be read on each execution. Maximum is 100.

AUTH0_API_ENDPOINTS.description: Allows you to filter specific API endpoints, comma separated.
AUTH0_API_ENDPOINTS.example: e.g.: users, connections, rules, logs, emails, stats, clients, tenants

WEBHOOK_CONCURRENT_CALLS.description: The maximum concurrent calls that will be made to your webhook

title: Auth0 Authentication API webhooks
name: auth0-authentication-api-webhooks
author: auth0
description: Allows you to define webhooks for Auth0's Authentication API. It will go through the audit logs and call a webhook for specific events.

BATCH_SIZE.description: The amount of logs to be read on each execution. Maximum is 100.

WEBHOOK_CONCURRENT_CALLS.description: The maximum concurrent calls that will be made to your webhook

LOG_LEVEL.description: This allows you to specify the log level of events that need to be sent

LOG_TYPES.description: If you only want to send events with a specific type (eg: failed logins)

title: Real-time Webtask Logs
name: auth0-extension-realtime-logs
author: auth0
description: Access real-time webtask logs

title: Auth0 Logs to Application Insights
name: auth0-logs-to-application-insights
author: auth0
description: This extension will take all of your Auth0 logs and export them to Application Insights

BATCH_SIZE.description: The amount of logs to batch before sending to Application Insights. A single cron execution will send multiple batches.

START_FROM.description: Checkpoint ID of log to start from.

SLACK_INCOMING_WEBHOOK_URL.description: Slack Incoming Webhook URL used to report statistics and possible failures

SLACK_SEND_SUCCESS.description: This setting will enable verbose notifications to Slack which are useful for troubleshooting

LOG_LEVEL.description: This allows you to specify the log level of events that need to be sent

LOG_TYPES.description: If you only want to send events with a specific type (eg: failed logins)

title: Auth0 Logs to Azure Blob Storage
name: auth0-logs-to-azure-blob-storage
author: auth0
description: This extension will take all of your Auth0 logs and export them to Azure Blob Storage

BATCH_SIZE.description: The amount of logs to batch before sending to Blob Storage. A single cron execution will send multiple batches.

START_FROM.description: Checkpoint ID of log to start from.

SLACK_INCOMING_WEBHOOK_URL.description: Slack Incoming Webhook URL used to report statistics and possible failures

SLACK_SEND_SUCCESS.description: This setting will enable verbose notifications to Slack which are useful for troubleshooting

LOG_LEVEL.description: This allows you to specify the log level of events that need to be sent

LOG_TYPES.description: If you only want to send events with a specific type (eg: failed logins)

title: Auth0 Logs to Logentries
name: auth0-logs-to-logentries
author: auth0
description: This extension will take all of your Auth0 logs and export them to Logentries

BATCH_SIZE.description: The amount of logs to be read on each execution. Maximum is 100.

LOG_LEVEL.description: This allows you to specify the log level of events that need to be sent

LOG_TYPES.description: If you only want to send events with a specific type (eg: failed logins)

options.text: When a device account is deleted
When a device account is updated
When a push notification is sent
Second factor auth enrollment is started
When tenant info has been updated
When second factor login has failed
When second factor authentication has succeeded
When One Time Password fails validation because rate limit is exceeded
When recovery validation fails because rate limit is exceeded

title: Auth0 Logs to Loggly
name: auth0-logs-to-loggly
author: auth0
description: This extension will take all of your Auth0 logs and export them to Loggly

BATCH_SIZE.description: The amount of logs to batch before sending to Logstash. A single cron execution will send multiple batches.

START_FROM.description: Checkpoint ID of log to start from.

SLACK_INCOMING_WEBHOOK_URL.description: Slack Incoming Webhook URL used to report statistics and possible failures

SLACK_SEND_SUCCESS.description: This setting will enable verbose notifications to Slack which are useful for troubleshooting

LOG_LEVEL.description: This allows you to specify the log level of events that need to be sent

LOG_TYPES.description: If you only want to send events with a specific type (eg: failed logins)

title: Auth0 Logs to Logstash
name: auth0-logs-to-logstash
author: auth0
description: This extension will continuously export your Auth0 logs to Logstash

BATCH_SIZE.description: The amount of logs to batch before sending to Logstash. A single cron execution will send multiple batches.

LOGSTASH_INDEX.description: Logstash Index (as defined in Logstash setup)

START_FROM.description: Checkpoint ID of log to start from.

SLACK_INCOMING_WEBHOOK_URL.description: Slack Incoming Webhook URL used to report statistics and possible failures

SLACK_SEND_SUCCESS.description: This setting will enable verbose notifications to Slack which are useful for troubleshooting

LOG_LEVEL.description: This allows you to specify the log level of events that need to be sent

LOG_TYPES.description: If you only want to send events with a specific type (eg: failed logins)

title: Auth0 Logs to Mixpanel
name: auth0-logs-to-mixpanel
author: auth0
description: This extension will take all of your Auth0 logs and export them to Mixpanel

MIXPANEL_TOKEN.description: Mixpanel Token - this is your Mixpanel Token for your mixpanel project

MIXPANEL_KEY.description: Mixpanel Key - this is your Mixpanel Key for your mixpanel project

BATCH_SIZE.description: The amount of logs to be read on each execution. Maximum is 20.

LOG_LEVEL.description: This allows you to specify the log level of events that need to be sent

LOG_TYPES.description: If you only want to send events with a specific type (eg: failed logins)

options.text: When a device account is deleted
When a device account is updated
When a push notification is sent
Second factor auth enrollment is started
When tenant info has been updated
When second factor login has failed
When second factor authentication has succeeded
When One Time Password fails validation because rate limit is exceeded
When recovery validation fails because rate limit is exceeded

title: Auth0 Logs to Papertrail
name: auth0-logs-to-papertrail
author: auth0
description: This extension will take all of your Auth0 logs and export them to Papertrail

BATCH_SIZE.description: The amount of logs to be read on each execution. Maximum is 100.

START_FROM.description: Checkpoint ID of log to start from.

SLACK_INCOMING_WEBHOOK_URL.description: Slack Incoming Webhook URL used to report statistics and possible failures

SLACK_SEND_SUCCESS.description: This setting will enable verbose notifications to Slack which are useful for troubleshooting

LOG_LEVEL.description: This allows you to specify the log level of events that need to be sent

LOG_TYPES.description: If you only want to send events with a specific type (eg: failed logins)

title: Auth0 Logs to Splunk
name: auth0-logs-to-splunk
author: auth0
description: This extension will take all of your Auth0 logs and export them to Splunk

SPLUNK_URL.description: Splunk URL - this is your Splunk HTTP Collector Endpoint

SPLUNK_TOKEN.description: Splunk Token - this is your Splunk Token

BATCH_SIZE.description: The amount of logs to batch before sending to Splunk. A single cron execution will send multiple batches.

START_FROM.description: Checkpoint ID of log to start from.

SLACK_INCOMING_WEBHOOK_URL.description: Slack Incoming Webhook URL used to report statistics and possible failures

SLACK_SEND_SUCCESS.description: This setting will enable verbose notifications to Slack which are useful for troubleshooting

LOG_LEVEL.description: This allows you to specify the log level of events that need to be sent

LOG_TYPES.description: If you only want to send events with a specific type (eg: failed logins)

title: Auth0 Account Link
name: auth0-account-link
author: auth0
description: This extension gives Auth0 customers the ability to allow their users to link their accounts

CUSTOM_CSS.description: Add custom styles to the linking page of the extension.

auth0.scopes: read:connections read:users read:rules create:rules update:rules delete:rules delete:clients

title: User Import / Export
name: auth0-user-import-export
author: auth0
description: This extension allows you to import/export users from/to your account.

title: GitLab Deployments
name: auth0-gitlab-deploy
author: auth0
description: This extension gives Auth0 customers the possibility to deploy Hosted Pages, Rules and Custom Database Connections from GitLab.
uninstallConfirmMessage: Do you really want to uninstall this extension? Doing so will stop any Hosted Pages,  Rules and Database Connection scripts from being deployed from GitLab to Auth0

auth0.scopes: read:tenant_settings update:tenant_settings update:clients read:clients read:connections update:connections read:rules create:rules update:rules delete:rules delete:clients

GITLAB_REPOSITORY.description: The repository from which you want to deploy rules and database scripts

GITLAB_BRANCH.description: The branch we should monitor for commits

GITLAB_TOKEN.description: Your personal access token for GitLab

SLACK_INCOMING_WEBHOOK_URL.description: Webhook URL for Slack used to notify you of successful and failed deployments

title: Auth0 Authorization
name: auth0-authz
author: auth0
description: This extension gives Auth0 customers the possibility to manage group memberships for their users.
updateConfirmMessage: Warning! Read the documentation about breaking changes (https://auth0.com/docs/extensions/authorization-extension) before updating the extension
uninstallConfirmMessage: You are about to uninstall the "Authorization Extension". If you proceed all your data in this extension will be lost. Do you want to continue?

auth0.scopes: read:connections read:resource_servers update:resource_servers delete:resource_servers read:clients delete:clients read:users read:rules create:rules update:rules delete:rules

STORAGE_TYPE.description: Choose the storage type for the database

title: SSO Dashboard
name: auth0-sso-dashboard
author: Auth0
description: This extension provides your users with a dashboard for all of their applications.

auth0.scopes: read:clients delete:clients read:connections read:resource_servers create:resource_servers read:client_grants create:client_grants delete:client_grants

EXTENSION_CLIENT_ID.description: Client ID of the application you created in the Auth0 Management Dashboard

CUSTOM_CSS.description: A CSS file containing custom styles for the extension

title: Auth0 Logs to Sumo Logic
name: auth0-logs-to-sumologic
author: auth0
description: This extension will take all of your Auth0 logs and export them to Sumo Logic

SUMOLOGIC_URL.description: Sumo Logic URL - this is your Sumo Logic HTTP Collector Endpoint

BATCH_SIZE.description: The amount of logs to batch before sending to Sumo Logic. A single cron execution will send multiple batches.

START_FROM.description: Checkpoint ID of log to start from.

SLACK_INCOMING_WEBHOOK_URL.description: Slack Incoming Webhook URL used to report statistics and possible failures

SLACK_SEND_SUCCESS.description: This setting will enable verbose notifications to Slack which are useful for troubleshooting

LOG_LEVEL.description: This allows you to specify the log level of events that need to be sent

LOG_TYPES.description: If you only want to send events with a specific type (eg: failed logins)

title: Delegated Administration Dashboard
name: auth0-delegated-admin
author: auth0
description: This extension allows non-dashboard administrators to manage (a subset of) users.

auth0.scopes: read:clients delete:clients read:connections read:users update:users delete:users create:users read:logs read:device_credentials update:device_credentials delete:device_credentials delete:guardian_enrollments

EXTENSION_CLIENT_ID.description: Client ID of the application you created in the Auth0 Dashboard

CUSTOM_CSS.description: A CSS file containing custom styles for the extension

FEDERATED_LOGOUT.description: Also sign out from the IDP when users logout?

title: GitHub Deployments
name: auth0-github-deploy
author: auth0
description: This extension gives Auth0 customers the possibility to deploy Pages, Rules and Custom Database Connections from GitHub.
uninstallConfirmMessage: Do you really want to uninstall this extension? Doing so will stop any Pages, Rules and Database Connection scripts from being deployed from GitHub to Auth0

auth0.scopes: read:tenant_settings update:tenant_settings create:clients read:clients update:clients read:connections update:connections read:rules create:rules update:rules delete:rules delete:clients read:resource_servers create:resource_servers update:resource_servers read:rules_configs delete:rules_configs update:rules_configs

GITHUB_REPOSITORY.description: The repository from which you want to deploy rules and database scripts

GITHUB_BRANCH.description: The branch we should monitor for commits

GITHUB_HOST.description: GitHub Enterprise host, leave empty for github.com

GITHUB_API_PATH.description: GitHub Enterprise API path prefix, leave empty for github.com

GITHUB_TOKEN.description: Your personal access token for GitHub

SLACK_INCOMING_WEBHOOK_URL.description: Webhook URL for Slack used to notify you of successful and failed deployments
